questions.text: A 17-year-old girl presents to a clinic in India with her parents for a routine health checkup. During the visit, she confides in the Medical Officer that she is in a consensual sexual relationship with her 19-year-old boyfriend. Aware of the recent changes in the Indian legal system, the medical officer reflects on the age of consent laws to ensure appropriate medical and legal advice is provided. As per Criminal Law (Amendment) Act, 2013, what is the age at which a person can legally give consent for sexual activities as per this amendment?
questions.explanation:
Ans. C) 18 years

Explanation:

  • • Explanation:
  • • The Criminal Law (Amendment) Act, 2013 , significantly altered the landscape of sexual offence laws in India . One of the pivotal changes was the revision of the age of sexual consent to 18 years . This change was enacted to enhance the protection of minors from sexual exploitation and abuse . Under this amendment, any sexual activity with a person below 18 years of age is considered statutory rape, regardless of consent.

Explanation:

  • • Explanation:

  • • Medicolegal Aspects : The presence of unruptured hymen is a presumption , but is not an absolute proof of virginity . The semilunar hymen often ruptures on both sides . The annular hymen which nearly closes the vaginal orifice may suffer several tears. Soon after the act, the torn margins are sharp, red and bleed on touch . Even when examined after 3–4 days of offence , the edges are swollen, congested and smaller. Signs of recent rupture of hymen are ragged tears in the hymen with lack of epithelial healing, edema and hemorrhage. The status of hymen is irrelevant because it can be torn due to cycling , riding or masturbation. An intact hymen does not rule out sexual violence, and a torn hymen does not prove previous sexual intercourse.
